title: Are NCERT books enough for viteee? - Quora
tags: Vellore Institute of Technology, Vellore Exams and Tests
Vellore Institute of Technology Engineering Entrance Examination (VITEEE)
National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: Vellore Institute of Technology Engineering Entrance Exam (VITEEE). An entrance exams which admits bachelor students. Yes, NCERT textbook are enough if you're preparing for VITEE it the entire syllabus will be covered. You need to be anonymous for asking question about VITEE. Some of the important NCERT books of VITEE are - NCERT maths textbook of class 12, Physics NCERT of class 10, Organic chemistry NCERT. As VITEE is an entrance exam so it is a costly exam. While purchasing book I must recommend you a MyPustak website which is devoted to provide books at FREE OF COST across every possible parts of India. MyPustak dream that each student or reader of India won't have to think about the procurcements of the book before wanting for it.  #orderbook #mypustak #ncertbooks

For JEE, VITEEE or any other competitive exams NCERT are must. But only NCERT books are not enough to score good marks in these exams. You have to study NCERT for these exams to strengthen your concepts and basics, but you also need some additional books for competitive exams like DC Pandey for Physics that have high level question to learn how to apply concepts that you learn from NCERT books to solve those problems. In short - NCERT books clear the conceptscompetitive book tell you how to think according to question and apply those concepts.They are complementary halves of each other. Also you should practice previous years papers to familiarize yourself with pattern and question formats. You can easily get these secondhand additional preparation books and NCERT books for FREE and delivered right to your home, from MyPustak. You just need to create an account on website search the books and order it.  Hope this helps you!!

First of all there is  a lot of difference between board exams and Competitive exams. You need a different preparation for both of them. Obviously you will study NCERT books for your board exams and that will give you the knowledge about all the concepts. Now for competitive exams such as JEE and VITEEE one needs to apply these concepts in a more productive way. These exams will test your speed and your ability of how fast you understand the question and what necessary concept you need to apply for a particular question. So i would suggest you to practice previous years question papers or any other material to get to know how the questions are asked,you will get a clear idea of how to prepare. considerable practice will yield you success. All the best for your exams

Hello Readers!! VITEEE- Vellore Institute of Technology Engineering Entrance Examination . The Exam is of 125 marks , 1 mark for each correct answer means the total number of questions is 125. The question paper divided in 5 section : Maths contains -40 questions.Physics contains -35 questions.Chemistry contains - 35 questions.English contains - 5 questions.Aptitude contains - 10 questions.VITEEE is much easier than JEE Mains . If you read NCERT twice or thrice thoroughly then you can easily score 100-110 out of 125 marks. If you don’t have class 11th and 12th NCERT books you can go with MyPustak website for Free second hand books . Hurry Up!!

Yeah they actually enough but I recommend you to also read DC Pandey for Physics mainly. And in case of chemistry questions had come more than ncert level so you need to practice some other references and for math I suggest you to complete objective Rd sharma and most importantly STICK TO THE "syllabus "

You are absolutely correct you just need ncert books to clear viteee exams. The exam is much easier than jee mains and any other exams. You just need to work on your problem solving skills that's all. Do check this app on play store which I think will be beneficial for you Refer Ncert
NCERT does cover a big amount of syllabus for VITEEE. But still, it's recommended that you go with JEE Mains level question for maths and chemistry. For physics, go with HC Verma.
I cannot vouch 100% that NCERT books are solely enough for the VITEEE. But, they are the most prominent preparatory material. And, instead of buying you can download the NCERT books here.
Yes NCERT textbooks are enough if you are preparing for VITEEE the entire syllabus will be covered. You need not be anonymous for asking questions about VITEEE.
If you are talking about the level of questioning, then yes. Or, there are some topics which aren't covered in NCERT and you can look in other reference books.

All of them are quite good Institutes but to be specific, in my opinion you should opt for VIT for Engineering. CSE is a non-core branch and if you work hard a bit, you can land into getting a good job as compared to the core branches.
Yes NCRT is enough for VITEEE.
